Posted By: Kirbster (10/16/2010 9:10:46 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Question: Since combat damage is assessed immediately at the beginning of the Combat Damage Step, and a creature is technically "blocked" as soon as blockers are declared (this being the reason we can still sac a [Sakura-Tribe Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sakura-Tribe Elder) after declaring it as a blocker, even though combat damage no longer uses the stack, so it can't kill anything), is it impossible to kill this creature with a block? The reason for this would be that the creature would be destroyed as soon as it blocks this creature, meaning before combat damage.
posts.html:
Question: Since combat damage is assessed immediately at the beginning of the Combat Damage Step, and a creature is technically "blocked" as soon as blockers are declared (this being the reason we can still sac a Sakura-Tribe Elder after declaring it as a blocker, even though combat damage no longer uses the stack, so it can't kill anything), is it impossible to kill this creature with a block? The reason for this would be that the creature would be destroyed as soon as it blocks this creature, meaning before combat damage.

Posted By: Missile_Penguin (3/28/2012 11:08:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: There's just something so terrifying about the thought of floating, disembodied, evil eyes. It's cards like this that make Magic great! It's too bad this can be bolted, unlike its more corpulent cousin, [Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evil Eye of Orms-by-Gore). What I'm wondering is whether or not this would kill a creature with protection from black, such as [White Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Knight). Technically, it's not dealing damage to it and it's not targeting it, so can it then destroy it? If so, WIN BUTTON!
posts.html:
